definitions: To propel (a boat) with a pole.
To push or prod with a pole.
To hit (a ball) with a pole or stick, especially in sports like billiards or hockey.
To restrict the growth of (a plant) by cutting back the main stem, often to encourage side shoots.
examples: He will pole the raft across the river.
The gardener decided to pole the bean plants.
She had to pole the boat through the shallow water.
He will pole the puck into the net.
